worklogs.comment:
martinradev commented on pull request #5071: ARROW-6216: Expose ZSTD compression level to user
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5071
 
 
   This patch exposes the ZSTD compression level to the user via the environment variable ARROW_ZSTD_COMPRESSION_LEVEL.
   This allows the user to pick a level suitable for the needs of the project instead of relying on the default
   one selected in Arrow.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

martinradev commented on issue #5071: ARROW-6216: [C++] Expose ZSTD compression level to user
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5071#issuecomment-521594294
 
 
   Some notes regarding the design decision in the patch:
   - As suggested, the compression level becomes part of ColumnProperties and has to be piped to the creation of the codec.
   - I explicitly did not add validation for what would be a reasonable compression level. That is because it would add maintenance overhead once the version of some codec is updated. As in, the range of 0, 30 makes sense for version 2.4 but for 2.5 the range is 0, 40. I am just sure that this will be missed when a compressor is updated. So, it's up to the user for them to know what to use, what compressor version is used and what compression level makes sense for his or her needs.
   - I added and updated tests to exercise the API but they are really smoke tests. It only verifies that the API is callable and no failures are observed.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/util/compression_brotli.cc
 ##########
 @@ -31,10 +31,6 @@
 namespace arrow {
 namespace util {
 
-// Brotli compression quality is max (11) by default, which is slow.
-// We use 8 as a default as it is the best trade-off for Parquet workload.
-constexpr int kBrotliDefaultCompressionLevel = 8;
 
 Review comment:
   IMHO it was fine to leave this default here.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
The compression level selected in Arrow for ZSTD is 1 which is the minimal compression level for the compressor. This leads to very high compression speed at the sacrifice of compression ratio.

The user should be allowed to select the compression level as both speed and ratio are data specific.

The proposed solution is to expose the knob via an environment variable such as ARROW_ZSTD_COMPRESSION_LEVEL.
 Example:
 export ARROW_ZSTD_COMPRESSION_LEVEL=10
 ./my_parquet_app

Here is a test run with compression levels of 1, 2 and 5:
Level   Time (s)   Size (mb)
1          13.02       181
2          13.10       177
5          19.44       148
fields.summary: [C++] Allow user to select the compression level
